In this position, the leader should have strong communication skills to effectively connect with both technical and non-technical audiences, including executive level presentations, which are critical in the success of this position.                  This dedicated leader will work effortlessly to ensure that they are focused and aligned with the      company s growth targets. The Google EMEA Channel Account Leader will be an experienced and efficient presenter that will work alongside Google SecOps Partner teams to enable sellers, align our field members, drive relevant events, leverage social media, assist with operational issues, support customer escalations, and manage relationships. They will have excellent people skills, business acumen, and an exemplary work ethic. The ideal individual will have a long history of building strong customer relationships, coupled with the market know-how to specify, strategize, and define opportunities.                  Job Duties and Responsibilities                  Execute Cyderes channel strategies to drive revenue and growth through our partnership with Google              Engage the Google Partner and Sales teams to develop joint GTM activities including joint business planning, enablement, account mapping, and sales initiatives.              Deliver compelling pitch of Cyderes Managed Services Offerings for Google Security solutions to Google Sales personnel. Make Cyders the preferred MSP partner for all Google Sales teams.              Manage and grow relationships with key Google SecOps counterparts, including sales and technical teams. Act as conduit between subject matter experts and key resources across both organizations.              Present Cyderes + Google offerings to Clients, ranging from Security Analysts to C-Level Executives              Monitor and evaluate competitor activity in region to ensure Cyderes outperforms other providers in business development and relationship management.              Coordinate and host events, bringing together Clients, Cyderes, and Google teams for opportunity development.              Collaborate with internal stakeholders to develop partner enablement programs and other support materials that are tailored to the needs of our Google partners.              Actively monitor channel performance and identify opportunities for optimization and growth                    Requirements                  5+ years experience in business development, strategic alliances, or channel sales at a cybersecurity organization              2+ years experience in a leadership role in either direct management or ownership of a region or geo.              Strong track record of success in building and managing successful partner programs              Exceptional relationship-building skills with the ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with key stakeholders.              Experience working with Google as a channel partner is highly preferred              Excellent communication, presentation, and negotiation skills              Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment                      Domain Experience        is extremely helpful in one or more of the following security domains:                MSSP              SIEM              EDR              SOAR                    Soft Skills                  Language Skills: Advanced level and ability to clearly communicate written and spoken English              Interpersonal skills: Ability to work well with people              Flexibility: Capable of adjusting to rapid change              Team Player: Willing to be a collaborative and reliable team member              Analytical Abilities: Possessing an eye for detail              Communication: Ability to communicate clearly and confidently in an international environment - ability to present to senior executives.              Commitment: Dedication to achieving goals while being results-oriented              Personality: Possessing an attitude fueled with positive-thinking                    Key Performance Indicators                  Pipeline Development for Cyderes Managed Services in assigned region.              Satisfaction level of Google and Cyderes Regional Sales Leadership in creating strong sell-with partnership              Engagement level of Cyderes and Google activity in region across Sales and Clients

column1: Sales Manager - IT Hardware and Solutions
column2: Company Website: https://www.truecom.co.in/ **Job Description: Sales Manager - IT Hardware and Solutions ** **Position Overview:** We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Sales Manager  (Government Sector)  to lead our sales efforts in the government sector for IT hardware and solutions. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of success in selling IT products and services to government departments, along with strong leadership and communication skills. Location  - Noida and Bhubaneshwar **Key Responsibilities:** 1. Develop and execute a strategic sales plan to achieve sales targets and expand market share within the government sector. 2. Build and maintain strong relationships with key decision-makers and stakeholders within government departments. 3. Identify new business opportunities and develop innovative strategies to win government contracts and tenders. 4. Lead and mentor a team of sales professionals, providing guidance and support to ensure individual and team success. 5. Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including marketing, product management, and customer support, to deliver integrated solutions that meet the unique needs of government clients. 6. Stay informed about industry trends, government regulations, and competitive offerings to effectively position our products and services in the market. 7. Prepare and present sales proposals, demonstrations, and negotiations to government clients, ensuring alignment with their objectives and requirements. 8. Track sales performance metrics, analyze data, and generate reports to evaluate progress and make data-driven decisions. 9. Represent the company at industry events, conferences, and trade shows to network with potential clients and promote our offerings. 10. Uphold high ethical standards and compliance with all relevant laws, regulations, and company policies. **Qualifications:** - Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or a related field; MBA preferred. - Proven track record of success in sales, with a minimum of 5 years of experience in selling IT hardware and solutions to government clients. - Strong understanding of government procurement processes, including RFPs, RFIs, and contract negotiations. - Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build rapport and influence decision-makers at all levels. - Strategic thinker with the ability to analyze market trends, identify opportunities, and develop actionable plans to drive revenue growth. - Results-oriented mindset with a focus on exceeding sales targets and delivering exceptional customer service. - Proficiency in CRM software, Microsoft Office Suite, and other sales productivity tools. - Willingness to travel as needed to meet with clients and attend industry events. **Benefits:** - Competitive salary and performance-based incentives. - Comprehensive benefits package, including health insurance, retirement savings plan, and paid time off. - Opportunities for professional development and career advancement within a growing organization. - Collaborative and inclusive work environment with a diverse team of talented professionals.
